description: This protocol was developed for transformation of Heterosigma akashiwo by electroporation. This species does not grow on solid medium, so transformants are grown "in bulk" and should not be considered clonal. We have had limited success with this protocol, which may need to be further optimized.

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

keywords: Heterosigma akashiwo, Raphidophyceae, electroporation, MAX Efficiency Buffer

components.data: Harvest exponential growth Heterosigma akashiwo culture (1-2 x 106 cells mL-1) by centrifugation at 1500 rpm for 90 s in a 50 mL sterile screw-cap tube. Remove the supernatant by pipetting.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Harvest exponential growth Heterosigma akashiwo culture (1-2 x 106 cells mL-1) by centrifugation at 1500 rpm for 90 s in a 50 mL sterile screw-cap tube. Remove the supernatant by pipetting.

components.data: Resuspend the cell pellet in a small volume of MAX Efficiency® Transformation Reagent for Algae (Invitrogen, Thermo Fischer Scientific, USA) with 384mM Sorbitol and transfer to a 2 ml microcentrifuge tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend the cell pellet in a small volume of MAX Efficiency® Transformation Reagent for Algae (Invitrogen, Thermo Fischer Scientific, USA) with 384mM Sorbitol and transfer to a 2 ml microcentrifuge tube.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of Electroporation of Heterosigma akashiwo
source_data.annotation: Note that this should say "Resuspend the cell pellet in a small volume of MAX Efficiency® Transformation Reagent for Algae (Invitrogen, Thermo Fischer Scientific, USA) or in 384mM Sorbitol."
source_data.thread_text: Note that this should say "Resuspend the cell pellet in a small volume of MAX Efficiency® Transformation Reagent for Algae (Invitrogen, Thermo Fischer Scientific, USA) or in 384mM Sorbitol."
source_data.body: Note that this should say "Resuspend the cell pellet in a small volume of MAX Efficiency® Transformation Reagent for Algae (Invitrogen, Thermo Fischer Scientific, USA) or in 384mM Sorbitol."

components.data: Transfer 200µl of cells into a 1.5ml Eppendorf tube and add upt to 20 µl (at least 1µg) of linearized plasmid DNA. Mix by tapping the mixture and incubate at room temperature for 10 mins.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer 200µl of cells into a 1.5ml Eppendorf tube and add upt to 20 µl (at least 1µg) of linearized plasmid DNA. Mix by tapping the mixture and incubate at room temperature for 10 mins.

components.data: Transfer the mixture to a 4 mm gap cold electroporation cuvette (BioRad). Electroporate in an electroporator, BioRad® Gene Pulser® (BioRad) at 50/75 Volts, 25 µF and ∞Ω and let it sit on bench at room temperature for 15mins. Typical electro pulse duration obtained is about 10–15 ms.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the mixture to a 4 mm gap cold electroporation cuvette (BioRad). Electroporate in an electroporator, BioRad® Gene Pulser® (BioRad) at 50/75 Volts, 25 µF and ∞Ω and let it sit on bench at room temperature for 15mins. Typical electro pulse duration obtained is about 10–15 ms.

components.data: Transfer the electroporated sample in equal amounts to 4 wells of 12 well plate with 2 ml of fresh f/2 medium with cefotaxime (100µg/ml, to control bacterial growth).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the electroporated sample in equal amounts to 4 wells of 12 well plate with 2 ml of fresh f/2 medium with cefotaxime (100µg/ml, to control bacterial growth).

components.data: Incubate in dim light for 1 day and then transfer to normal light conditions for another 2 days. After 3–4 days, add appropriate antibiotic and incubate in normal conditions.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate in dim light for 1 day and then transfer to normal light conditions for another 2 days. After 3–4 days, add appropriate antibiotic and incubate in normal conditions.

components.data: Transformants should be visible after 20-30 days. Continue to transfer the live cells to fresh medium every 10-12 days with antibiotic and analyse transformants by PCR once sufficient culture is obtained.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transformants should be visible after 20-30 days. Continue to transfer the live cells to fresh medium every 10-12 days with antibiotic and analyse transformants by PCR once sufficient culture is obtained.
